meanings.definition: The action of defiling or the state of being defiled.
meanings.sent1: The defilements of the river were caused by industrial waste.
meanings.sent2: The defilements on the wall were hard to clean.
meanings.sent3: The defilements in the kitchen sink seemed to have a party of their own.
meanings.sent4: The defilements of corruption spread like a dark cloud over the city.
meanings.sent5: The defilements of neglect were evident in the abandoned house.

meanings.definition: Something that defiles or pollutes, such as impurities or sins.
meanings.sent1: The defilements of lies tarnished his reputation.
meanings.sent2: The defilements in the water made it unsafe to drink.
meanings.sent3: The defilements of gossip floated around the office.
meanings.sent4: The defilements of jealousy poisoned their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The defilements of greed corrupted his soul.
